column1: #Text=Chor Muang is very delicious and a portion of colorful food .
#Text=Below this , is an amazingly delicious recipe !
#Text=( Boneless , or combination of chicken and seafood , minced )
#Text=In a teapot , measure 1 tbsp of dry Butterfly Pea flowers and add 1 cup of boiling water .
#Text=While the tea is steeping , prepare the stuffing and caramelize garlic for serving .
#Text=In a bowl , mix all wheat starch and 15g of tapioca starch with a whisk .
#Text=Stir the blue teat and strain , lightly squeezing the flowers in a strainer .
#Text=Measure 155ml of blue water into a teacup and bring it to boiling in a microwave .
#Text=Immediately pour it all at once into the bowl with starches and combine into a paste using chopsticks .
#Text=Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let it rest for 5 minutes at room temperature .
#Text=# Add the rest of tapioca starch and knead the dough until all well combined and soft .
#Text=Add oil and knead until the blue dough is smooth , soft , and pliable .
#Text=Shape the dough into a cylinder 1 " D and divide into 12 portions 1 " long .
#Text=Keep them covered with a damp towel or plastic wrap to prevent drying .
#Text=Line bamboo baskets with lightly oiled parchment paper .
#Text=Shape dumpling one by one and place into the baskets .
#Text=Flatten each portion of dough into a round wrapper .
#Text=Place 1 tsp of filling in the center , and shape it into a ball .
#Text=Steam dumplings for 5-6 minutes over medium heat .
#Text=Peel and mince 3 tsp of fresh garlic .
#Text=Ground white ( or black and white ) peppercorns .
#Text=Mince chicken ( and prawns or scallops , if using ) .
#Text=Combine 1 tsp of garlic , 1 tsp of cilantro stems , and 1/3 tsp ground pepper and make a paste using a knife or mortar and pestle .
#Text=Heat 2 tsp of oil in a small skillet over medium heat .
#Text=Saute garlic-cilantro-pepper paste for a few seconds , stirring , until sweet fragrance .
#Text=Add chicken and stir-fry it for a minute , breaking clumps , until white .
#Text=Season with fish sauce and sugar and continue cooking until caramelized , for about 1-2 minutes .
#Text=Transfer into a small bowl and let cool to the room temperature .
#Text=In a small skillet or saucepan , heat oil over low heat .
#Text=Add minced or sliced garlic and slowly caramelize it until lightly golden .
#Text=Strain oil and use for other recipes .
#Text=To serve , arrange green leafy vegetables and hot steamed dumplings on the plate and top them with crispy and sweet caramelized garlic .
#Text=Butterfly pea flowers used for this recipe came from a family-owned farm in Thailand .
